result.execSummary:
The defendant Tamisha D Bass was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber if imposed.
04/10/2017 COURT GRANTS 12 DAYS SENTENCE CREDIT
Probation may be transfered to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs.  Costs paid in full.  Balance refunded to poster.

No contact with any victim or business listed in the criminal complaint or the employees of the business.  No use or possession of any devices used to commit any retail thefts.  Maintain employment and/or school combination.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by the Agent.  
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

ADDRESS INFO for Tamisha D Bass
Current: 4123 N. 6th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212 United States  (Effective: 07-18-2016)
Prior: 515 West Moreland Blvd, C/O Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Tamisha D Bass in court with Attorney Samuel W. Benedict.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Shannon Tenney appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1 on amended information.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1 on amended information.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Benedict makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:

150 DAYS HUBER 

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR      **transfer allowed to Milwaukee County**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: victim/business listed in criminal complaint or employees of business 
____No use or possession of any devices used to commit retail thefts

COSTS:  $253.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bail posted ($500.00) and remainder to be returned to poster)

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 18, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
